intro: Hebenstretia elongata, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Hebenstretia elongata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
